result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin D Kuhn

records.addlTxt:
8:42 AM Defendant Kevin D Kuhn in court.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Kevin D Kuhn.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court addresses the WCS report. 
State did receive a lab report in this matter. 
Defense did receive a copy of the amended information, waive reading and enter not guilty pleas. 
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 10-26-2022 received and filed.
Lab Report
Adjourned order to show cause hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:52 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Defendant Kevin D Kuhn in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Kevin D Kuhn. 
Atty Wang states her client has filed private counsel in this matter. 
Atty Wang requests to withdraw in this matter.  
Court will grant motion to withdraw in this matter.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
dated 8/26/22 from WCS re: compliance report
Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:11 AM Defendant Kevin D Kuhn in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called to address bail. Argument made by Atty. Wang for reduction in cash bail. State objects to modification.   The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail. Defense has not received discovery yet.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter to Defendant re: bail reduction hearing
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 06-08-2022 regarding a bail reduction.
Bail/bond hearing on June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed by Atty. Angela Wang
Hearing on June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:22 AM Defendant Kevin D Kuhn in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.   Patrick Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Adrian Vesnefsky, of the Town of Brookfield Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Campbell.
Cross examination by attorney Wang.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and requests to dismiss count 2.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 06-04-2022 regarding bail reduction hearing.

ADDRESS INFO for Kevin D Kuhn
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 05-31-2022)
Prior: 9348 S 35th St, Franklin, WI 53132

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day of being released.

03:16 PM Defendant Kevin D Kuhn in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.
